data.title: Beautiful green space
data.text: I loved the mix of sculpture/walls and open space.  We were there in the evening, and enjoyed sitting on the benches while we watched everyone walk by.

data.title: Nice little park in Downtown Asheville
data.text: We walked through this park on a Saturday morning and there were a lot of people milling around. The park has a nice Veterans Memorial area as well as a large outdoor amphitheater. There was an Arts in the Park event going on with some great local vendors displaying there handmade crafts. Its a nice park for picnics or just relaxing after a stroll around downtown Asheville.

data.title: Downtown with Pigs
data.text: A must see for travelers visiting Asheville. Many Karmic based stores, museums, great restaurants and art galleries. On a warm October afternoon also a great place to people watch. Many buskers and entertainers as well. Several large parking garages are in the area and make the experience easy on the weary driver.

data.title: Wonderful Park, amphitheater and Splash Attraction
data.text: Only went there at night on our way back to the parking deck.  Large and lovely square with a splash attraction for kids, a lovely amphitheater, and a Veteran's Memorial.

data.title: Take a look at the Courthouse
data.text: Pack Square is great for the walking tour and to look at some of the great art deco architecture of the Court House.  Close to downtown and easily accessible.

data.title: Nice square
data.text: Nice open space.  Historical buildings. Fountains. Veteran memorial. Easy walk around and in the heart of all kinds of doiwntoiwn shops and restaurants.

data.title: Meeting Spot
data.text: Located close to several office and government buildings, this square adds a festive aspect to the area. There are some interesting art/sculptures within the square. Numeroous restaurants and cafes line the square. There are plenty of benches and shaded area that are great for people-watching.

data.title: Great on a hot day!
data.text: We stopped while visiting downtown and our son loved the splashville area.  He didn't have a swim suit, but we didn't stop him from playing in the water fountains anyway. Your only a kid once!!  He totally had a blast. According to the guest center, its only open April till October and has set times, but if your down there and its on, go splash around!

data.title: Nice square in Down Town
data.text: This is a very nice open square with lots of nice restaurants around it.  Will definitely visit it again.

data.title: Happy and Safe
data.text: Folks in this great mountain town, as it does not seem like a city, is truly a must see if you stop for Friday Drum Circle night.  The place is packed in this outside venue with great people enjoying great people, dogs and cats are welcomed too.  I had the pleasure of living here for some 10 + years and still have hundreds of friends there.

data.title: Beautiful city park.
data.text: I have spent a day just enjoying this park or watching a 4th of July concert. Great place for concerts or for kids to enjoy the fountains.

data.title: LEAF festival
data.text: What a great time we had at the Leaf festival.  Can't believe we saw WAR live for free.  Everyone seemed to really enjoy themselves and got along peacefully.

data.title: Completely bummed!
data.text: Our almost 2 year old daughter loves playing in water so we planned this stop at Splashville in Pack Square just for her. She was all excited, in her swimsuit and ready to splash. Imagine her disappointment when we find out it is closed for repairs. Shut down on July 27 for plumbing issues. Locals informed us that it happens every year and that they were surprised it lasted as long as it did this year. Not schedumed to be up and runnjng until the middle of August. Major disappointment.

data.title: Almost always action/fun here!
data.text:
The heart of downtown Asheville is definitely Pack Square. Many events occur here year round, all fun and worth participating or enjoying. Festivals, Easter fun, music venues, faires of all kinds.
Important to note when you are there, you are within walking distance of so many local restaurants, bars, theatres, most are locally owned farm-to-table organic and delicious. Many offer indoor or outdoor dining, enjoy the many huskers/singers/guitar/drum/banjo/statue and so many types of street entertainment galore. This area ALWAYS has a LOT of people walking around the streets in afternoons, evenings and into the wee hours. So people watching is another ecellent activity to enjoy around Pack square.

data.title: Music and art lovers haven
data.text: This beautiful large park is located in downtown Asheville. It stretches for several blocks and is filled with sculptures, beautiful landscapes, and historic monuments. Additionally, they offer a free music concert on Saturday called Shindig on the Green with various bluegrass and mountain music artists. It is a free event and a nice treat.

data.title: People Watching Mecca
data.text: Great place to stop, sit and people watch.  The fountain draws the kiddies and pups.  There is always music wafting from the corner adding to the comfortable upscale urban atmosphere.

data.title: Nice place to people watch!
data.text: Park Square  is a very nice downtown  place to people watch , hang out , play in the water, there are shops , bars and restaurants  all within walking distance

data.title: Pack Square
data.text: Art the center of downtown Asheville, this is a good place to start your expiration of the city.  There is a visitor center that has maps, information about attractions, and knowledgeable staff to answer your questions.  Good restrooms also.

data.title: Great place to hang out!
data.text: Really enjoyed our visit for Shindig on the Green.  Nice stage set up for artists to perform.  Parking was a breeze in the garage on College Street.  Restaurants and shops all right there within easy walking distance.

data.title: Love the Western NC Veterans Memorial
data.text: My family and I enjoyed spending Memorial Weekend in Asheville. One of the highlights, which was extremely fitting with the holiday weekend, was seeing the Western NC Veterans Memorial.  We just happened upon this memorial while walking around and had no idea it existed prior to that discovery. Very difficult to express in words the respect conveyed with this beautiful memorial. Definitely recommend visiting Pack Square and viewing this while enjoying the park. When making this review, I could not find this memorial on trip advisor as its own entity, believe it would be visited more (especially during certain holidays) if more people knew about it.
